summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and the court regarding the case United States v. Maxwell. It includes a forwarded letter from defense counsel about suppression motions and an order signed by Judge Nathan that will be entered into the public docket.

persons.name: Jeff Pa liuc
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of an email from Nathan NYSD Chambers regarding an order in the case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Mentioned as the author of defense counsel's letter to the court regarding suppression motions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Signed the order attached to the email that will be entered into the public docket for the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Menninger, as defense counsel, submitted a letter to the court (Judge Nathan) regarding suppression motions.

events.title: Court Order Signed in Maxwell Case
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan signed an order in the case United States v. Maxwell, which was to be entered into the public docket.

events.title: Defense Counsel Letter on Suppression Motions
events.description: Defense counsel Laura Menninger submitted a letter to the court regarding the need to resolve suppression motions in the Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20-cr-330).
Defense counsel Laura Menninger wrote a letter to the court about the need to resolve suppression motions.
Judge Alison J. Nathan signed an order on April 21, 2021, which was to be entered into the public docket.
The correspondence involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
